snippet: A small but growing number of private colleges are freezing tuition and rethinking policies that have driven up prices to unsustainable levels.
abstract: Editorial applauds the small but growing number of private colleges who are freezing tuition and rethinking policies that have driven up prices to unsustainable levels; notes that colleges whose endowments are too small to allow tuition freezes have a number of other options open to them in order to make private education available to financially hard-pressed students.
